texto: Today, most teenagers in the UK own a smartphone. They use them for many things, but social media is the most popular activity. Apps like TikTok, Instagram, and Snapchat allow them to share videos and photos with their friends. However, some experts are worried. They say that teens spend too much time on their screens and not enough time sleeping or doing exercise. A recent study says that students who use their phones late at night often have worse grades at school. It is important to find a balance between technology and real life.

texto: Climate change is one of the biggest challenges for our planet. The Earth's temperature is rising because of greenhouse gases from factories, cars, and planes. This is causing polar ice to melt and sea levels to rise. Extreme weather, like heatwaves and heavy storms, is becoming more frequent. Young people around the world are protesting and asking governments to take action. We can help by recycling, using less plastic, and saving energy at home. Every small action counts to protect our environment.

texto: King Arthur is a legendary British leader who lived many centuries ago. According to the legend, he became king because he was the only person who could pull a magic sword, Excalibur, out of a stone. He lived in a castle called Camelot with his beautiful queen, Guinevere. Arthur was famous for his Knights of the Round Table. They were brave men who fought for justice and helped people in danger. Although historians don't know if Arthur was a real person, his stories are still very popular in books and movies today.

texto: Thailand is a popular destination for young travellers. Many students go there after finishing school or university. It is a beautiful country with amazing beaches, ancient temples, and delicious street food. Most backpackers stay in cheap hostels to save money. They travel around by train or 'tuk-tuk', a traditional three-wheeled taxi. People in Thailand are very friendly, which is why it is called 'The Land of Smiles'. However, it is important to respect the local culture and follow the rules in temples.

texto: Video games have changed a lot since they started. The first video game was 'Pong', a very simple tennis game created in the 1970s. In the 1980s, games like Pac-Man and Mario became worldwide hits. Today, graphics are incredible and we can play with people from different countries using the internet. Some people think that video games are bad for your health, but other studies show that they can improve your coordination and problem-solving skills. The future of gaming is Virtual Reality, which makes you feel like you are inside the game!

texto: Before the 15th century, books were written by hand. This was very slow and books were very expensive. In 1440, Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press in Germany. This machine could print many pages quickly using metal letters. Because of this invention, books became cheaper and more people learned how to read and write. Scientists could share their discoveries and ideas easily. Many people believe the printing press is one of the most important inventions in human history because it started a revolution in knowledge.

texto: Mars is often called 'The Red Planet' because of its iron-rich soil. Scientists are very interested in Mars because they think there was water there in the past. Today, robots called 'rovers' are exploring the surface and sending photos back to Earth. In the future, NASA wants to send humans to Mars. It is a dangerous mission because the trip takes about six or seven months. Astronauts will have to live in special habitats because there is no oxygen and it is very cold. It will be the greatest adventure of the 21st century!

texto: Eating a balanced diet is the best way to stay healthy. You should eat at least five portions of fruit and vegetables every day. They have many vitamins and minerals. It is also important to eat protein, like fish, chicken, eggs or beans, to help your muscles grow. You should avoid eating too much sugar because it's bad for your teeth and your heart. Drinking plenty of water is better than drinking soda. Remember: 'You are what you eat', so choose your food carefully!

texto: William Shakespeare is the most famous writer in the history of the English language. He was born in 1564 in Stratford-upon-Avon, England. He wrote 38 plays and many poems. His plays are divided into comedies, like 'A Midsummer Night's Dream', and tragedies, like 'Romeo and Juliet' or 'Hamlet'. He was also an actor and he owned a theatre called 'The Globe' in London. Today, his works are translated into every language and people still perform them in theatres all over the world.

texto: Artificial Intelligence, or AI, is technology that allows computers to 'think' and learn like humans. You can find AI in many places, like the voice assistants on your phone or the recommendations on Netflix. AI can help doctors find diseases or tell us the best route to avoid traffic. However, some people are afraid of AI. They think that robots might take people's jobs in the future. It is important to use AI responsibly and make sure it is safe for everyone. AI is not the future; it is already here!
